Sentencas: The low-temperature co-sintering technique for the fabrication of the multi-layered electrolyte supported on a planar anode substrate is demonstrated for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Low-temperature co-sintering technique for the fabrication of multi-layer functional ceramics for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A NiO/gadoliniadoped ceria (GDC) anode substrate is fabricated using tape casting and lamination processes, and yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) bottom electrolyte and GDC top electrolyte layers are sequentially screen printed, followed by co-sintering at 1230 degrees C.
Titulo: Low-temperature co-sintering technique for the fabrication of multi-layer functional ceramics for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The electrolyte layers are successfully densified at an extremely low processing temperature by promoting the sinterability of the individual components, and a continuously graded electrolyte structure is constructed to suppress the delamination of the electrolyte films.
Titulo: Low-temperature co-sintering technique for the fabrication of multi-layer functional ceramics for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Based on the camber analysis, the cell structure is optimized to minimize the structural distortion and eliminate the processing defects.
Titulo: Low-temperature co-sintering technique for the fabrication of multi-layer functional ceramics for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The low-temperature co-sintering technique presented in this study is expected to widen the material selection and resolve the compatibility issues associated with high-temperature processing for the fabrication of SOFCs.
Titulo: Low-temperature co-sintering technique for the fabrication of multi-layer functional ceramics for solid oxide fuel cells
